author: Abghoui, Abghoui, Amar, Amar, Amar, Amar, Amar, Appl, Baharuddin, Fan, Fanone, Fu, Garagounis, Giddey, Gong, Hu, Ibrahim A. Amar, Jiang, John Humphreys, Kim, Kim, Kreuer, Kuhn, Lan, Lan, Lan, Lan, Lan, Licht, Lin, Marnellos, Olivares, Ouzounidou, Perman, Rong Lan, Shanwen Tao, Skodra, Tan, Tanabe, US G. Survey, Vasileiou, Vasileiou, Wang, Xia
title: Electrochemical synthesis of ammonia from wet nitrogen via a dual-chamber reactor using La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3\342\210\222\316\264-Ce0.8Gd0.18Ca0.02O2\342\210\222\316\264 composite cathode
abstract: A La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3\342\210\222\316\264-Ce0.8Gd0.18Ca0.02O2\342\210\222\316\264 composite cathode was used to investigate the electrochemical synthesis of ammonia from wet nitrogen. Wet nitrogen was flown through a dual chamber reactor under atmospheric pressure leading to the successful synthesis of ammonia. Ammonia was synthesised at a rate of 1.5 \303\227 10\342\210\22210 mol s\342\210\2221 cm\342\210\2222 at 400 \302\260C when applying a dc voltage of 1.4 V, which is the highest reported to date. This rate is twice that of the observed ammonia formation rate (7 \303\227 10\342\210\22211 mol s\342\210\2221 cm\342\210\2222) when Co-free cathode, La0.6Sr0.4FeO3\342\210\222\316\264-Ce0.8Gd0.18Ca0.02O2\342\210\222\316\264 was used as the cathode catalyst. A higher catalytic activity for ammonia synthesis may be obtained when using a catalyst with high oxygen vacancies, with the introduction of oxygen vacancies at the cathode being a good strategy to improve the catalytic activity of ammonia synthesis
